Title: Kogas plans to buy more term LNG to mitigate impact of higher prices, market volatility
Description: Korea’s state-owned Kogas, one of the world’s largest LNG importers, is planning to buy more LNG on both a long- and short-term basis to mitigate its exposure to high LNG prices and price volatility from spot LNG cargo purchases
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies agrees 0.6 mtpa 15-year term LNG deal with Korea’s Hanwha Energy
Description: TotalEnergies has agreed to supply Korea’s Hanwha Energy with 0.6 mtpa of LNG over 15 years, starting in 2024. The supply will come from TotalEnergies’ global LNG supply portfolio and will be delivered to state-owned Kogas’ 19.5 mtpa Tongyeong LNG receiving terminal.
Author: CK
